  "title": "HR Field Officer",
  "description": "Eta Zuma Mining and Industries Limited provides premium solutions to businesses in the primary and secondary sectors of the economy, especially those in solid minerals, extractive industry, manufacturing industry and agriculture. Some of its clients are Zuma 828 Coal Limited, IMEX Mineral Resources and Processing Company, Zuma Energy Nigeria Limited, Zuma Steel W/A Limited, and Zuma Metals &amp; Energy Resources Limited.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Field Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Kogi

Description


	The HR Field Officer will operates primarily in the pit operational area, ensuring the consistent enforcement of all ZCL policies and practices across daily Open cast and Highwall Mining operations.
	This role involves hands-on supervision of field staff, real-time compliance monitoring, and direct liaison between pit activities and the HCM Unit.
	The officer plays a critical role in promoting discipline, safety adherence, and workforce coordination during mining activities.


Key Responsibilities


	Monitor and oversee the activities of all personnel working in the pit operational area (Open cast and Highwall mining operations.
	Conduct unscheduled spot checks to ensure tasks are performed as assigned, and safety protocols are in use.
	Enforce proper conduct on-site and immediately address any misconduct or report to the HCM Supervisor.
	Participate in roll calls before and after Highwall Mining to verify attendance and manpower adequacy.
	Ensure staff allocation aligns with safety, operational plans, and manpower requirements during critical mining operations.
	Ensure adherence to attendance and safety regulations within the operational environment.
	Compile and submit daily and weekly reports, specifically on Highwall Mining operations.
	Support the onboarding of newly employed field workers and offer field-specific orientations.
	Assist in organizing sensitization sessions in relations to the ZCL Employee Handbook.
	Perform other related duties as assigned by the HCM Supervisor/Head - General Services.


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Human Resources, Industrial Relations, Business administration or related fields
	Minimum of 2 years of HR or field supervisory experience, preferably in a mining or industrial setting.
	Strong leadership and observational skills.
	High attention to detail and integrity in reporting.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools.
	Ability to work independently in remote or rugged field conditions.

HR Field Officer Job at Eta Zuma Mining & Industries Limited




        
    

        
        Eta Zuma Mining and Industries Limited provides premium solutions to businesses in the primary and secondary sectors of the economy, especially those in solid minerals, extractive industry, manufacturing industry and agriculture. Some of its clients are Zuma 828 Coal Limited, IMEX Mineral Resources and Processing Company, Zuma Energy Nigeria Limited, Zuma Steel W/A Limited, and Zuma Metals & Energy Resources Limited.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Field Officer

Job Location: Kogi

Description

	The HR Field Officer will operates primarily in the pit operational area, ensuring the consistent enforcement of all ZCL policies and practices across daily Open cast and Highwall Mining operations.
	This role involves hands-on supervision of field staff, real-time compliance monitoring, and direct liaison between pit activities and the HCM Unit.
	The officer plays a critical role in promoting discipline, safety adherence, and workforce coordination during mining activities.


Key Responsibilities


	Monitor and oversee the activities of all personnel working in the pit operational area (Open cast and Highwall mining operations.
	Conduct unscheduled spot checks to ensure tasks are performed as assigned, and safety protocols are in use.
	Enforce proper conduct on-site and immediately address any misconduct or report to the HCM Supervisor.
	Participate in roll calls before and after Highwall Mining to verify attendance and manpower adequacy.
	Ensure staff allocation aligns with safety, operational plans, and manpower requirements during critical mining operations.
	Ensure adherence to attendance and safety regulations within the operational environment.
	Compile and submit daily and weekly reports, specifically on Highwall Mining operations.
	Support the onboarding of newly employed field workers and offer field-specific orientations.
	Assist in organizing sensitization sessions in relations to the ZCL Employee Handbook.
	Perform other related duties as assigned by the HCM Supervisor/Head - General Services.


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Industrial Relations, Business administration or related fields
	Minimum of 2 years of HR or field supervisory experience, preferably in a mining or industrial setting.
	Strong leadership and observational skills.
	High attention to detail and integrity in reporting.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools.
	Ability to work independently in remote or rugged field conditions.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Head, Content Management",
  "description": "Mastercard Foundation is a global foundation based across four hubs in Kigali, Rwanda, Nairobi, Kenya, Accra, Ghana and Toronto, Canada. Our programs promote financial inclusion and advance education and learning in Africa, primarily for young people, and in Canada for Indigenous youth. The Foundation was established in 2006 through the generosity of Mastercard when it became a public company. From inception, the Foundation was designed to be a separate entity and independent from Mastercard. Our policies, operations, and funding decisions are made by our President and Board of Directors.

The Foundation believes that youth employment is key to unlocking prosperity, both for youth and their societies. Enabling young women and men from disadvantaged communities to secure dignified and fulfilling work will ensure inclusive development and economic growth in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Head, Content Management

Job Requisition ID:&nbsp;JR-0000000307
Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria
Job type: Full Time (12-Month Contract - Leave Coverage)

Job Description


	Reporting to the Director, Knowledge Management, the Head, Content Management (12-Month Contract) will lead the development, optimization, and continuous improvement of the Mastercard Foundation&rsquo;s Enterprise Content Management (ECM) systems, with a strong focus on SharePoint Modern.
	In this role, you will join a mission-driven Foundation, working alongside a multidisciplinary team at the forefront of knowledge management, digital transformation, and social impact.
	The ideal candidate is a seasoned leader in enterprise content management, with deep expertise in SharePoint administration and information architecture.
	In this pivotal role, you will be responsible for driving content and records management strategy and execution, including governance, taxonomy, search optimization, and translating business needs into effective, user-friendly digital environments.
	The successful candidate will be based in any of our offices in Canada and Africa (Ethiopia, Nigeria, Senegal, Ghana, Rwanda, Kenya, or Uganda).


Responsibilities


	Provide strategic and hands-on leadership in the administration and optimization of SharePoint and related Microsoft 365 platforms, including site architecture, permission structures, metadata, and content types.
	Lead the design and implementation of scalable, secure, and user-friendly enterprise content management (ECM) solutions.
	Develop and enforce taxonomy, metadata standards, and search optimization practices, leveraging SharePoint&rsquo;s term store and enterprise search capabilities.
	Partner with IT, Cybersecurity, and other stakeholders to ensure strong governance, compliance, and privacy frameworks across ECM initiatives.
	Oversee content migration, site modernization, and the rollout of new SharePoint features and integrations.
	Champion change management, training, and capability-building to drive ECM and SharePoint adoption across the Foundation.
	Translate business needs into technical and information architecture requirements; review and approve related design decisions.
	Guide continuous ECM improvements informed by user feedback, analytics, and emerging best practices.
	Manage vendor relationships to ensure the successful delivery and enhancement of ECM and SharePoint services.
	Oversee the Foundation&rsquo;s Records Management Program, including use of Microsoft Purview for retention and archiving.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Knowledge Management, Information or Library Science, Computer Science, or related field.
	7+ years of progressive experience in enterprise content management, with demonstrated, hands-on expertise as a SharePoint administrator (including SharePoint Online/Modern).
	Relevant certifications in SharePoint, Microsoft 365, Information Architecture, or Project Management are a strong asset.
	Proven experience designing, building, and optimizing SharePoint site architectures, modern pages, content types, permission models, and metadata strategies.
	Advanced knowledge of information architecture, taxonomy development, term store management, and federated search within the Microsoft 365 ecosystem.
	Strong understanding of governance, compliance, security, and change management practices as applied to SharePoint and ECM platforms.
	Track record of leading and developing high-performing technical and functional teams, including cross-functional and remote staff.
	Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills; able to translate business needs into robust digital solutions.
	Strategic, adaptable, and service-oriented, with a deep commitment to knowledge equity and the mission of the Foundation.
	Possess excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills with the ability to articulate information to a variety of constituents across cultures. &nbsp;
	Possess professional maturity, sensitivity with different cultures, and impeccable integrity that exemplifies the Foundation&rsquo;s values.
	Demonstrate a commitment to Mastercard Foundation&rsquo;s values and vision.

Head, Content Management Job at Mastercard Foundation




        
    

        
        Mastercard Foundation is a global foundation based across four hubs in Kigali, Rwanda, Nairobi, Kenya, Accra, Ghana and Toronto, Canada. Our programs promote financial inclusion and advance education and learning in Africa, primarily for young people, and in Canada for Indigenous youth. The Foundation was established in 2006 through the generosity of Mastercard when it became a public company. From inception, the Foundation was designed to be a separate entity and independent from Mastercard. Our policies, operations, and funding decisions are made by our President and Board of Directors.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



The Foundation believes that youth employment is key to unlocking prosperity, both for youth and their societies. Enabling young women and men from disadvantaged communities to secure dignified and fulfilling work will ensure inclusive development and economic growth in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, Content Management

Job Requisition ID: JR-0000000307
Job Location: Nigeria
Job type: Full Time (12-Month Contract - Leave Coverage)

Job Description


	Reporting to the Director, Knowledge Management, the Head, Content Management (12-Month Contract) will lead the development, optimization, and continuous improvement of the Mastercard Foundation’s Enterprise Content Management (ECM) systems, with a strong focus on SharePoint Modern.
	In this role, you will join a mission-driven Foundation, working alongside a multidisciplinary team at the forefront of knowledge management, digital transformation, and social impact.
	The ideal candidate is a seasoned leader in enterprise content management, with deep expertise in SharePoint administration and information architecture.
	In this pivotal role, you will be responsible for driving content and records management strategy and execution, including governance, taxonomy, search optimization, and translating business needs into effective, user-friendly digital environments.
	The successful candidate will be based in any of our offices in Canada and Africa (Ethiopia, Nigeria, Senegal, Ghana, Rwanda, Kenya, or Uganda).


Responsibilities


	Provide strategic and hands-on leadership in the administration and optimization of SharePoint and related Microsoft 365 platforms, including site architecture, permission structures, metadata, and content types.
	Lead the design and implementation of scalable, secure, and user-friendly enterprise content management (ECM) solutions.
	Develop and enforce taxonomy, metadata standards, and search optimization practices, leveraging SharePoint’s term store and enterprise search capabilities.
	Partner with IT, Cybersecurity, and other stakeholders to ensure strong governance, compliance, and privacy frameworks across ECM initiatives.
	Oversee content migration, site modernization, and the rollout of new SharePoint features and integrations.
	Champion change management, training, and capability-building to drive ECM and SharePoint adoption across the Foundation.
	Translate business needs into technical and information architecture requirements; review and approve related design decisions.
	Guide continuous ECM improvements informed by user feedback, analytics, and emerging best practices.
	Manage vendor relationships to ensure the successful delivery and enhancement of ECM and SharePoint services.
	Oversee the Foundation’s Records Management Program, including use of Microsoft Purview for retention and archiving.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Knowledge Management, Information or Library Science, Computer Science, or related field.
	7+ years of progressive experience in enterprise content management, with demonstrated, hands-on expertise as a SharePoint administrator (including SharePoint Online/Modern).
	Relevant certifications in SharePoint, Microsoft 365, Information Architecture, or Project Management are a strong asset.
	Proven experience designing, building, and optimizing SharePoint site architectures, modern pages, content types, permission models, and metadata strategies.
	Advanced knowledge of information architecture, taxonomy development, term store management, and federated search within the Microsoft 365 ecosystem.
	Strong understanding of governance, compliance, security, and change management practices as applied to SharePoint and ECM platforms.
	Track record of leading and developing high-performing technical and functional teams, including cross-functional and remote staff.
	Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills; able to translate business needs into robust digital solutions.
	Strategic, adaptable, and service-oriented, with a deep commitment to knowledge equity and the mission of the Foundation.
	Possess excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills with the ability to articulate information to a variety of constituents across cultures.  
	Possess professional maturity, sensitivity with different cultures, and impeccable integrity that exemplifies the Foundation’s values.
	Demonstrate a commitment to Mastercard Foundation’s values and vision.

Purchasing Analyst Job at the Place - Smackers Limited




        
    

        
        The Place is a fast growing, world class, and dynamic, multi-billion Nigerian conglomerates, established and managed by a team of professionals with decades of management consulting and accounting experience/ training from Arthur Andersen (now KPMG in Nigeria). We are a profitable player in the QSR sector of the Hospitality industry in Nigeria with great prospects and staff strength of over 1000 employees. Currently, our operations span across 17 locations in Lagos and Abuja, Nigeria, with rapid expansion plans to penetrate more locations in the short to medium term.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Purchasing Analyst - Northern Nigeria
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Northern Nigeria (Abuja)
Job Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are a leading QSR looking to employ Research & Sourcing personnel who will play a key role in building our direct farmer engagement and strategic sourcing capabilities.
	This opportunity involves in -dept market research, Frequent travel across Nigeria and cultivating strong supplier relationships to ensure a reliable and cost-effective supply of agricultural products.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and establish direct sourcing channels with farmers and agricultural cooperatives.
	Conduct comprehensive market research and price analysis to inform and optimize procurement strategies.
	Undertake regular travel to key agricultural regions to negotiate terms and develop a robust network of suppliers.
	Provide timely and insightful reports on market trends, supply chain efficiencies, and potential risks.
	Collaborate closely with internal teams to align sourcing activities with overall business objectives.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Agric related course, Procurement, Supply Chain Management, or a related discipline.
	2-3 years of proven experience in research, sourcing, or supply chain roles, preferably within the agricultural sector (ThriveAgric or Babangona).
	Must be male
	Demonstrable skills in market analysis, negotiation, and building strong, lasting relationships with suppliers.
	A strong willingness and ability to travel extensively within Nigeria and work directly with agricultural producers.
	Excellent analytical skills and proficiency in data analysis and reporting tools.
	Ability to speak hausa language fluently is essential.


Remuneration
Our remuneration is very attractive and includes our profit-sharing scheme.

title: Job Vacancies at Codelabprojects Nigeria Limited
content:
Codelabprojects Nigeria Limited is a tech Company offering a range of digital solutions and services tailored to meet the unique needs of our clients. Our services include Web and Mobile Application Development, Business and IT Solutions, Digital Marketing, Search Engine Optimization, Website/E-commerce, Branding and Print solutions, among others.

We are recruiting to fill the following position below:

1.) Civil / Structural Engineer

Job Location: Ibeju-Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a qualified and experienced Civil Engineer to oversee and manage construction projects from conception to completion.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, planning, and supervising infrastructure projects while ensuring compliance with engineering standards, safety regulations, and company policies.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, design, and supervise civil engineering projects such as buildings, roads, bridges, and drainage systems.
	Prepare and review project drawings, technical specifications, and cost estimates.
	Conduct site inspections to monitor progress, quality, and adherence to safety standards.
	Coordinate with architects, contractors, and other stakeholders to ensure smooth project execution.
	Provide technical guidance and ensure compliance with local and national engineering codes.
	Manage project budgets, resources, and timelines effectively.
	Prepare and present progress reports and documentation for management review.
	Identify potential risks or design issues and propose practical engineering solutions.
	Ensure quality assurance and quality control (QA/QC) standards are maintained throughout all phases of the project.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering or related field.
	3–5 years of relevant experience in civil/construction projects.
	Proficiency in AutoCAD, Civil 3D, and other engineering design software.
	Strong understanding of structural analysis, project management, and construction methodologies.
	Excellent communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
	COREN registration or eligibility for COREN certification is an added advantage.


Preferred Qualifications:


	Master’s degree in Civil/Structural Engineering or related field.
	Project Management Professional (PMP) certification.
	Experience in government or large-scale infrastructure projects.


Salary
N250,000 Monthly. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@codelabprojects.com using Civil Engineer – [Their Name]” as the subject of the email.

Note
Kindly answer the following questions:


	Where do you stay?
	This is a Full-time, on-site role. Are you comfortable?
	Are you comfortable with the advertised salary? N250,000
	Can you resume immediately?


 

 

2.) Digital Marketer

Job Location: Sabon-Lugbe, Abuja  (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time, Onsite

Job Summary


	The Digital Marketer will support our marketing team in developing, implementing, and managing online marketing campaigns.
	The ideal candidate will expand the company's brand presence by finding the target audience to distribute marketing content to
	You will create and implement the marketing strategy using both offline and online methods to gain new customers.
	The ideal candidate is both a self-motivated individual and a positive team player.


Key Responsibilities


	Creating and managing content for social media platforms, blogs, email campaigns, and websites
	Conduct SEO/SEM strategies and conduct keyword research
	Monitor and report on the performance of digital campaigns using analytics tools
	Help manage marketing calendars and schedule posts
	Engage with online communities and respond to comments/messages
	Conduct market research and competitor analysis
	Assist in developing graphics and visuals for marketing content
	Support general administrative tasks within the marketing team
	Plan and execute digital marketing campaigns
	Develop and manage website content


Requirements


	2 years of experience with digital marketing tools (e.g., Canva, Google Analytics, Meta Business Suite, Mailchimp, GMB) is a plus
	Strong verbal and written communication skills
	Creativity and a passion for digital trends
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
	Basic knowledge of social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, TikTok)
	Creative mindset with the ability to design strategies that resonate with target audiences.
	Excellent time management and organizational skills.
	Certification in Google Ads or Facebook Blueprint (preferred but not mandatory).


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@codelabprojects.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note


	Only candidates who live in Abuja — specifically Lugbe, Airport Road, Galadimawa, and their environs — will be considered for this role.
	Kindly answer the following questions:
	
		Where do you stay?
		This is a Full-time, on-site role. Are you comfortable?
		Are you comfortable with the advertised salary?
		Are you available to start immediately?
	
	


 

3.) Electrical Engineer (GENCO Experience)

Job Location: Ibeju-Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Job Summary


	The Electrical Engineer will be responsible for designing, maintaining, and improving electrical systems and components in a power generation environment (GENCO).
	The ideal candidate will possess strong technical expertise in power systems, hands-on experience in generation plant operations, and proficiency in CAD tools for electrical design and schematics.
	The role requires a COREN-certified professional with demonstrated leadership and analytical skills to ensure optimal plant performance and compliance with safety and regulatory standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Design, develop, and oversee the installation and maintenance of electrical systems, equipment, and components within the power generation plant.
	Perform detailed electrical load calculations, system studies, and protection coordination.
	Conduct root-cause analysis of electrical faults and recommend effective corrective measures.
	Supervise and support electrical technicians and contractors in daily operations and maintenance activities.
	Prepare and review technical drawings, schematics, and wiring diagrams using AutoCAD or other CAD software.
	Ensure compliance with electrical codes, safety regulations, and quality standards (e.g., NERC, NEMSA, COREN).
	Participate in equipment inspection, testing, and commissioning of power systems and control panels.
	Develop preventive and predictive maintenance schedules to minimize downtime.
	Provide technical support for plant upgrades, retrofitting, and modernization projects.
	Maintain accurate documentation of electrical systems and updates to as-built drawings.
	Support project management efforts — including cost estimation, procurement support, and contractor evaluation.
	Collaborate cross-functionally with mechanical, civil, and control engineers for integrated plant operations.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or related discipline.
	5–10 years of professional experience in the power generation (GENCO) sector.
	COREN certification (mandatory).
	Strong knowledge of electrical systems in power plants — including generators, transformers, switchgear, protection systems, and control circuits.
	Proficiency in CAD software (AutoCAD Electrical preferred).
	Experience with SCADA, PLCs, or other control systems is an added advantage.
	Strong understanding of health, safety, and environmental standards.
	Excellent analytical, troubleshooting, and documentation skills.
	Proven leadership and team coordination capabilities.
	Ability to manage multiple tasks and work under pressure with minimal supervision.


Preferred Skills:


	Experience with electrical system modeling tools (ETAP, DIgSILENT PowerFactory, etc.)
	Knowledge of national grid codes and regulatory requirements.
	Project management or PMP certification (advantageous).
	Familiarity with renewable or hybrid power systems (optional but beneficial).


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@codelabprojects.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note
Kindly answer the following questions:


	Where do you stay?
	This is a Contract, on-site role. Are you comfortable?
	Are you comfortable with the advertised salary? 
	Can you resume immediately?
    

    

        Click here to Apply
